summary.para: An 'improved' which caches often used properties
A standard call to 'transform' and 'gameobject' makes a call to the C++ side of Unity (where it is cached)
this call has some overhead which can be removed by caching these on the C# side

member.summary: The transform of this object

member.summary: Overridden to return the CachedTransform

member.summary: Overridden to return the CachedGameObject

member.name: T:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle
member.summary: A representation of a timer which invokes an event after a certain amount of seconds pass (possibly loops)

member.name: E:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.OnTimerExpire
member.summary: The callback to invoke when the timer expires

member.name: P:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.CurrentTime
member.summary: The amount of seconds remaining until the callback invokes

member.name: P:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.CurrentTimeNormalized
member.summary: A value of [0,1] that represents the % between 0 and the startTime of the timer

member.name: P:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.StartTime
member.summary: The amount of seconds that the timer started with (will be reset to this value when the timer loops)

member.name: P:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.IsLooping
member.summary: Whether or not the timer should reset itself upon expiring

member.name: P:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.IsPaused
member.summary: If a timer is paused the internal timer will not be updated

member.name: P:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.IsValid
member.summary: Whether or not this handle still represents an active timer (will be false if a non-looped timer expires)

member.name: M:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.ResetTimer
member.summary: Reset the internal timer immediately to

member.name: M:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.SetLoop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether or not the timer should loop after expiring
member.param: Should the timer loop after expiring?

member.name: M:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.SetStartTime(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Set the of the timer
This will only have an effect if the timer is reset or loops
member.param: The new start time for the timer
Whether the timer should reset after setting the new start time

member.name: M:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.SetPause(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pause the timer to temporarily prevent updating the internal timer

member.name: M:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.Stop
member.summary:
Stop this timer immediately and prevent further updates
If you mean to temporarily pause a timer, use instead

member.name: M:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle.CompareTo(VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerHandle)
member.summary:
Compare using the StartTime
(uses CurrentTime if equal)

member.name: T:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerManager
member.summary:
Manager class for all timers
use to update all timers
The timers are updated in reversed order so the last one in the list will be updated first

member.name: M:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerManager.StartNewTimer(System.Double,System.Action,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Start a new timer
member.param: The time in seconds after which the callBack will be called
The callback to invoke once the timer expires
Whether this timer should loop (restart once it ends)
member.returns:
A handle to the timer, this can be used to Pause the timer or change some properties
It can also be safely ignored if not needed

member.name: M:VDFramework.Utility.TimerUtil.TimerManager.Update(System.Double)
member.summary: Updates the internal timer of each with deltaTime
member.param: The amount to update the timers with
